sentences.en: Added option to override the warning to save file.
sentences.cn: 增加超越警告保存文件选项.

sentences.en: An override of the veto appears unlikely.
sentences.cn: 看来推翻这项否决的可能性很小。

sentences.en: Big companies think they can sometimes override local opinion.
sentences.cn: 大公司认为它们对地方舆论有时候可以置之不理。

sentences.en: Considerations of safety override all other concerns.
sentences.cn: 对安全的考虑压倒一切.

sentences.en: Derived classes cannot override an interface member implemented in a base class.
sentences.cn: 派生类不能重写在基类里面实现的接口成员.

sentences.en: Override this member function to perform the OK button action.
sentences.cn: 重载这个成员函数来实现OK按钮操作.

sentences.en: The analyst's judgement then must override mathematical and statistical significance.
sentences.cn: 分析家的判断必须超越数学和统计的有效性.

sentences.en: The bill now goes to the House where an override vote is expected to fail.
sentences.cn: 该议案现在提交到众议院，在这里否决投票预计不会获得通过。

sentences.en: The EU commission exercised its power to override British policy.
sentences.cn: 欧盟委员会行使其权力来否决英国的政策。

sentences.en: The needs of the windmill must override everything else, he said.
sentences.cn: 他说,为风车所需要的东西一定要不惜一切代价.

sentences.en: The president vetoed the bill, and the Senate failed by a single vote to override his veto.
sentences.cn: 总统否决了该议案，而参议院以一票之差未能推翻他的否决。

sentences.en: The president vetoed the bill, but congress override his veto.
sentences.cn: 总统否决了议案, 但国会将它推翻.

sentences.en: The welfare of a child should always override the wishes of its parents.
sentences.cn: 孩子的幸福安康应该永远比父母的愿望来得更重要。

sentences.en: These experiments left little doubt that appropriate light changes could override signals from the biological clock.
sentences.cn: 这些试验使我深信不疑,适当的光照变化能够克服来自“生物钟”的信号.

sentences.en: This override method is used by List and Show.
sentences.cn: 这个覆盖方法用于列表和显示.

sentences.en: Whoever modified it must have given it the ability to override my direct control.
sentences.cn: 被改进过的型号一定被赋予了违背我直接命令的能力.

phrases.tran_cn: 手动超越控制；并联手动阀

trans.tran_cn: 制服, 践踏, 奔越过, 蹂躏, 不顾, 不考虑(某人的意见,决定,愿望等)
trans.tran_en: to use your power or authority to change someone else’s decision

trans.tran_cn: 推翻，无视，践踏，优先于，覆盖
